title: Introduction to Data Science
text:
This book was written to fill a gap in the literature. It is intended for an audience:

With little to no programming experience
Interested in Data Science as an idea
Wanting to become more comfortable working with data

title: 1  Introduction
text:
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.




Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  Summary
text: In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

title: 3  Example Notebook
text:
With some body text.
To test if everything is working, see Figure 3.1.


Code
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(-5,5)
y = x**2

plt.plot(x,y, linewidth=4)
plt.show()





Figure 3.1: A simple quadratic curve.




Figure 3.1 above is a cool demonstration of what the Quatro publishing suite can do using notebook.
